Package com.library.backend.services.admin

Class AddBookQuantityService

java.lang.Object
com.library.backend.services.admin.AddBookQuantityService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service
public class AddBookQuantityService extends Object implements Service
The AddBookQuantityService class provides functionality to increase the quantity of books associated with a given BookInventory. It ensures valid quantity input and handles the creation and addition of new books to the inventory.

Example Usage: 

 
 // Create an AddBookQuantityService instance with BookRepository and BookInventoryRepository
 AddBookQuantityService addBookQuantityService = new AddBookQuantityService(BookRepository.getInstance(), BookInventoryRepository.getInstance());

 // Increase the quantity of books in a BookInventory
 try {
     BookInventory bookInventory = // obtain a BookInventory instance;
     addBookQuantityService.increaseBookQuantity("5", bookInventory);
     // Book quantity increased successfully
 } catch (NumberFormatException | InvalidQuantityException | ObjectCannotBeNullException e) {
     // Handle the case where increasing the book quantity fails
 }
In this example, an AddBookQuantityService instance is created with the necessary repositories, and the increaseBookQuantity method is used to add a specified quantity of books to a given BookInventory. If the book quantity is increased successfully, the log will indicate success; otherwise, an exception is thrown with details about the failure.

The AddBookQuantityService class implements the Service interface, providing a common interface for various services in the application.

  • Method Details

    • increaseBookQuantity

      public void increaseBookQuantity(String quantityString, BookInventory bookInventory) throws NumberFormatException, InvalidQuantityException, ObjectCannotBeNullException
      Increases the quantity of books in the provided BookInventory.
      Parameters:
      quantityString - The string representing the quantity to increase.
      bookInventory - The BookInventory instance to which books will be added.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - If the provided quantity string cannot be parsed into an integer.
      InvalidQuantityException - If the provided quantity is invalid (non-positive).
      ObjectCannotBeNullException - If the provided BookInventory is null.
